I wanted to help the community, since someone could find this helpful.

item.title: [RuneSource 317]Adding a Gem Cutting system
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

zyle1992:

Also, that’s an improper way of using a two-dimensional array.

That’s the first thing I noticed.

If you’re using two different for-each loops, you just need to include one of the variables in the search through the array rather than both.
Meaning (random example), instead of:

2dArray1[i][j];
shouldBeNormArray[i][j];
2dArray1[i][j];
isNormArray[i];

Because one of the variables is necessary for use in both array types.

Read full topic

item.title: [RuneSource 317]Adding a Gem Cutting system
item.dc:creator: @I_Roll_Deep I Roll Deep
item.description:
@I_Roll_Deep wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:5, topic:413152”][code=Java]
/**

  • Represents the different types of gems found in the game.

  • @author Zyle Moore

  • @version 0.1
    */
    public enum Gem {
    OPAL(1609, 1625, 1, 15),
    JADE(1611, 1627, 13, 20),
    RED_TOPAZ(1613, 1629, 16, 25),
    SAPPHIRE(1607, 1623, 20, 50),
    EMERALD(1605, 1621, 27, 57.5F),
    RUBY(1603, 1619, 34, 85),
    DIAMOND(1601, 1617, 43, 107.5F),
    DRAGONSTONE(1615, 1631, 55, 137.5F),
    ONYX(6573, 6571, 67, 167.5F);

    private final int uncutId;
    private final int cutId;
    private final int levelReq;
    private final float exp;

    private Gem(final int uncutId, final int cutId, final int levelReq,
    final float exp) {
    this.uncutId = uncutId;
    this.cutId = cutId;
    this.levelReq = levelReq;
    this.exp = exp;
    }

    /**

    • Returns the Item id of the uncut gem.
    • @return the uncut gem id
      */
      public int getUncutId() {
      return uncutId;
      }

    /**

    • Returns the Item id of the cut gem.
    • @return the cut gem id
      */
      public int getCutId() {
      return cutId;
      }

    /**

    • Returns the Crafting level required to cut the gem.
    • @return the level requirement
      */
      public int getLevelReq() {
      return levelReq;
      }

    /**

    • Returns the experience gained from successfully cutting the gem.
    • @return the experience gained
      */
      public float getExp() {
      return exp;
      }
      }
      [/code]

Might make it neater. Also, when cutting semi-precious gems (Opal, Jade, Red Topaz) the experience for failing is 25% of the normal amount.[/quote]
My gem cutting base do not have topals, etc…

Read full topic

item.title: [RuneSource 317]Adding a Gem Cutting system
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

/**
 * Represents the different types of gems found in the game.
 * 
 * @author Zyle Moore
 * @version 0.1
 */
public enum Gem {
    OPAL(1609, 1625, 1, 15),
    JADE(1611, 1627, 13, 20),
    RED_TOPAZ(1613, 1629, 16, 25),
    SAPPHIRE(1607, 1623, 20, 50),
    EMERALD(1605, 1621, 27, 57.5F),
    RUBY(1603, 1619, 34, 85),
    DIAMOND(1601, 1617, 43, 107.5F),
    DRAGONSTONE(1615, 1631, 55, 137.5F),
    ONYX(6573, 6571, 67, 167.5F);

    private final int uncutId;
    private final int cutId;
    private final int levelReq;
    private final float exp;

    private Gem(final int uncutId, final int cutId, final int levelReq,
        final float exp) {
        this.uncutId = uncutId;
        this.cutId = cutId;
        this.levelReq = levelReq;
        this.exp = exp;
    }

    /**
     * Returns the Item id of the uncut gem.
     * 
     * @return the uncut gem id
     */
    public int getUncutId() {
        return uncutId;
    }

    /**
     * Returns the Item id of the cut gem.
     * 
     * @return the cut gem id
     */
    public int getCutId() {
        return cutId;
    }

    /**
     * Returns the Crafting level required to cut the gem.
     * 
     * @return the level requirement
     */
    public int getLevelReq() {
        return levelReq;
    }

    /**
     * Returns the experience gained from successfully cutting the gem.
     * 
     * @return the experience gained
     */
    public float getExp() {
        return exp;
    }
}

Might make it neater. Also, when cutting semi-precious gems (Opal, Jade, Red Topaz) the experience for failing is 25% of the normal amount.

Also, that’s an improper way of using a two-dimensional array.

Read full topic

item.title: [RuneSource 317]Adding a Gem Cutting system
item.dc:creator: @I_Roll_Deep I Roll Deep
item.description:
@I_Roll_Deep wrote:

Hello. As I see, no one’s making tutorials for RuneSource, so I’ll be making some of them.
[left][font=tahoma][size=13px]
Protocol: 317
Tested on: RuneSource
Requirments: Copy Paste knowledge
Difficulty: 1/10
Length: Short

Step 1:

In: \src\com\rs2\model\content\skills, make a new class called “CuttingGems”.

Copy paste this into it:

[/size][/font][code]
package com.rs2.model.content.skills;

import com.rs2.model.World;
import com.rs2.model.npcs.Npc;
import com.rs2.model.players.Player;
import com.rs2.model.players.Item;

public class CuttingGems {

public static void handleChisel(Item id4, Item id5, Player c) {

int id1 = id4.getId();
int id2 = id5.getId();
if (id1 == 1755)
cutGem(id2, c);
else
cutGem(id1, c);
}

public static int[][] gems = {{1623,1607},{1621,1605},{1619,1603},{1617,1601},{1631,1615},{6571,6573}};
public static int[][] anims = {{888},{889},{887},{890},{885},{2717}};
public static int[][] level = {{20},{27},{34},{43},{55},{67}};
public static int[][] XP = {{70},{150},{260},{500},{700},{1500}};
public static void cutGem(int id, Player c) {
for (int j = 0; j < gems.length; j++) {
if (gems[j][0] == id) {
if (c.getSkill().getLevelForXP(c.getSkill().getExp()[12]) >= XP[j][0]) {
c.getInventory().removeItem(new Item(id));
c.getInventory().addItem1(new Item(gems[j][1]), 1);
c.getUpdateFlags().sendAnimation((anims[j][0]), 0);
c.getSkill().addExp((XP[j][0]), 12);
break;
} else {
c.getActionSender().sendMessage(“You need a crafting level of " + level[j][0] + " to craft this.”);
}
}
}
}
}[/code][font=tahoma][size=13px]

Requires a Chisel to start gem cutting
[/size][/font]public static void handleChisel(Item id4, Item id5, Player c) {[font=tahoma][size=13px]

gems = uncut ID, gem ID, level requirments, xperience
anims = Animation IDs
level = level requirments
XP = Experience gain

[/size][/font] public static int[][] gems = {{1623,1607},{1621,1605},{1619,1603},{1617,1601},{1631,1615},{6571,6573}}; public static int[][] anims = {{888},{889},{887},{890},{885},{2717}}; public static int[][] level = {{20},{27},{34},{43},{55},{67}}; public static int[][] XP = {{70},{150},{260},{500},{700},{1500}};[font=tahoma][size=13px]

Checks the gem ID, removes the uncut used, adds the new gem, sends the cutting animation, adds experience.

[/size][/font] if (gems[j][0] == id) { if (c.getSkill().getLevelForXP(c.getSkill().getExp()[12]) >= XP[j][0]) { c.getInventory().removeItem(new Item(id)); c.getInventory().addItem1(new Item(gems[j][1]), 1); c.getUpdateFlags().sendAnimation((anims[j][0]), 0); c.getSkill().addExp((XP[j][0]), 12);[font=tahoma][size=13px]

Sends a message if don’t have the required level to craft a gem.

[/size][/font] } else { c.getActionSender().sendMessage("You need a crafting level of " + level[j][0] + " to craft this."); }[font=tahoma][size=13px]

Step 2:
Open your ItemPacketHandler class, and add this to your imports:
[/size][/font]import com.rs2.model.content.skills.CuttingGems;[font=tahoma][size=13px]

Next, search for this:
[/size][/font]Item useWithItem = player.getInventory().getItemContainer().get(withSlot);[font=tahoma][size=13px]

Below, add this:
[/size][/font]CuttingGems.handleChisel(useItem, useWithItem, player);[font=tahoma][size=13px]

That`s it.

Pictures:
[/size][/font][/left]
[left][font=tahoma][size=13px][/size][/font][/left]
[left][font=tahoma][size=13px][/size][/font][/left]
[left][/left]
[left][font=tahoma][size=13px]Credits:[/size][/font][/left]
[left]
[ul][li][font=tahoma]ArrowzFtw[/font][/li]
[li][font=tahoma]I Roll Deep[/font][/li][/ul]
[/left]

Read full topic
